message_1:
What is the mean of the following time series data for the number of customers in a store during the first six months of the year: 

January: 120 customers
February: 140 customers
March: 150 customers
April: 170 customers
May: 180 customers
June: 200 customers
message_2:
To find the mean of the time series data, you need to add up the total number of customers for each month and then divide by the number of months.

Mean = (January + February + March + April + May + June) / 6

Mean = (120 + 140 + 150 + 170 + 180 + 200) / 6

Mean = (960) / 6

Mean = 160

The mean number of customers in the store during the first six months of the year is 160 customers.
